info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 31 at 11:48AM EDT by NWS Pittsburgh
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT SOUTHEASTERN WASHINGTON... EASTERN GREENE...SOUTHWESTERN FAYETTE...NORTHWESTERN MONONGALIA... NORTHEASTERN WETZEL AND NORTHWESTERN MARION COUNTIES THROUGH 1215 PM EDT... At 1147 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Fairview, or 9 miles north of Mannington, moving northeast at 45 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Waynesburg, Masontown, Fredericktown-Millsboro, Fairdale, Jefferson Boro, Point Marion, Cassville, Isabella, Deemston, Bobtown, Nemacolin, and Carmichaels. This includes the following highways... Interstate 79 in Pennsylvania between mile markers 0 and 15. Interstate 79 in West Virginia between mile markers 158 and 160. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
